5.1 - Concrete Testing (Consistency, 28-day compressive strength, Shrinkage, Permeability, Water absorption, Sulphite content, Alkali content, Chloride content, Temperature rise)
REQUIREMENTS / REFERENCE - MS-41P - 5P MS-41P - 12P, MS-41P – table 6.1P
○ 28-day compressive strength: NZS 3109, Section 9 and NZS 3112
○ Temperature rise: Not applicable as pours are less than 0.9m thick (as per MPS Temperature Control Plan)
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Consistency: For water retaining structures, slump tolerances shall be half those given in Table 9.1 of NZS 3109
○ Shrinkage: 430mS at 21 days, 600 mS at 56 days with variance 10% precast & 15% for cast in-situ
– Chloride content: As per table 5-1 of MS-41P
– Temperature rise: The lesser of: Thermal Control Plan limits
• <40°C temperature rise from its fresh concrete casting temperature
FREQUENCY/PROCESS HELD - Consistency: Slump test every batch 28 days compressive strength: 3 Cylinders (1x7day, 2x28 day per shift or per 75m3 poured (NZS 3104), whichever is more frequent.
○ Permeability: Every 1,500m3 of concrete Water absorption: Every 1,500m3 of concrete Sulphite content: Every 1,500m3 of concrete
○ Permeability: Every 1,500m3 of concrete Water absorption: Every 1,500m3 of concrete Sulphite content: Every 1,500m3 of concrete
○ Temperature rise: Not applicable as pours are less than 0.9m thick (as per MPS Temperature Control Plan)
RECORDS OR CHECKLISTS - Lab Results. Witness point release after witnessing of in-situ/immediate tests and sampling for longer tests.
